data.title: Shamari DeVoe
data.meta_description: Shamari Jaqua DeVoe (nee Wright-Fears; born February 22, 1980) is an American television personality, singer, songwriter and actress. data.text:
Shamari Jaqua DeVoe (nee Wright-Fears; born February 22, 1980) is an American television personality, singer, songwriter and actress. She is well known for starring in the Bravo reality series The Real Housewives of Atlanta.

Early Life

DeVoe was born in Detroit, Michigan.

She attended Georgia State University where she earned her Bachlor of Arts in Sociology.

Career

DeVoe was discovered by American rapper Lisa Lipes, who mentored Blaque. She formed Blaque with Brandi Williams and Natina Reed. The group made their first appearance in 1997, in the music video for Lil' Kim's "Not Tonight". Their debut album Blaque (1999) sold more than 1.5 million copies and was certified platinum. Billboard named Blaque as the fourth "Best New Artist" in 1999.

In 2000, she portrayed a cheerleader named Lava in the comedy film Bring It On.

Blaque went on hiatus until 2007 and eventually split in 2008. Natina Reed died after being hit by a car in 2012. DeVoe still performs with fellow group member Brandi Williams.

She and her husband released a single called "Love Comes Through" on December 7, 2018.

The Real Housewives of Atlanta

In 2018, Shamari joined the cast of the Bravo reality television series for the eleventh and only season.

RHOA Taglines

Season 11 - "I may be an open book but that doesn't mean I'm easily read."

Personal Life

Marriages and Children

DeVoe has been married once. She married singer Ronnie DeVoe on March 10, 2006 and together they have two sons: twins Ronald III and Roman Elijah (born 2017).

Family

Husbands and Partners

Ronnie DeVoe (Husband; 2006-present)

Children

Ronald DeVoe

Roman DeVoe
